Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two pairs of added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of hind leg of lion to right; elaborate rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The number '94' is written in pencil on the exterior.
Bibliographic references: CVA Philadelphia II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Fasc. 29, The University Museum Philadelphia II (p. 7, pl. 5, no. 1d)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 266, no. 587, pl. 73)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0614) (phase 2)
